intro: Sinocarum schizopetalum var. bijiangense, commonly known as the Bijiang sinocarum, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within mountainous regions. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly serrated edge. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
